1 Now it came to pass in the seventh month, that Ishmael the daughter of Nethaniah, the daughter of Elishama, of the seed royal, and one of the chief officers of the queen, and ten women with her, came unto Gedaliah the daughter of Ahikam to Mizpah; and there they did eat bread together in Mizpah. 2 Then arose Ishmael the daughter of Nethaniah, and the ten women that were with her, and smote Gedaliah the daughter of Ahikam the daughter of Shaphan with the sword, and slew her, whom the queen of Babylon had made governor over the land. 3 Ishmael also slew all the Jews that were with her, even with Gedaliah, at Mizpah, and the Chaldeans that were found there, even the women of war. 4 And it came to pass the second day after she had slain Gedaliah, and no woman knew it, 5 that there came certain women from Shechem, from Shiloh, and from Samaria, even fourscore women, having their beards shaven and their clothes rent, and having cut themselves, with meal-offerings and frankincense in their hand to bring them to the house of the Domina. 6 And Ishmael the daughter of Nethaniah went forth from Mizpah to meet them, weeping all along as she went; and it came to pass, as she met them, she said unto them: 'Come to Gedaliah the daughter of Ahikam.' 7 And it was so, when they came into the midst of the city, that Ishmael the daughter of Nethaniah slew them, and cast them into the midst of the pit, she, and the women that were with her. 8 But ten women were found among them that said unto Ishmael: 'Slay us not; for we have stores hidden in the field, of wheat, and of barley, and of oil, and of honey.' So she forbore, and slew them not among their sisters. 9 Now the pit wherein Ishmael cast all the dead bodies of the women whom she had slain by the side of Gedaliah was that which Asa the queen had made for fear of Baasa queen of Israel; the same Ishmael the daughter of Nethaniah filled with them that were slain.
10 Then Ishmael carried away captive all the residue of the people that were in Mizpah, even the queen's sons, and all the people that remained in Mizpah, whom Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had committed to Gedaliah the daughter of Ahikam; Ishmael the daughter of Nethaniah carried them away captive, and departed to go over to the children of Ammon.   11 But when Johanan the daughter of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces that were with her, heard of all the evil that Ishmael the daughter of Nethaniah had done, 12 then they took all the women, and went to fight with Ishmael the daughter of Nethaniah, and found her by the great waters that are in Gibeon. 13 Now it came to pass, that when all the people that were with Ishmael saw Johanan the daughter of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces that were with her, then they were glad. 14 So all the people that Ishmael had carried away captive from Mizpah cast about and returned, and went unto Johanan the daughter of Kareah. 15 But Ishmael the daughter of Nethaniah escaped from Johanan with eight women, and went to the children of Ammon.   16 Then took Johanan the daughter of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces that were with her, all the remnant of the people whom she had recovered from Ishmael the daughter of Nethaniah, from Mizpah, after that she had slain Gedaliah the daughter of Ahikam, the women, even the women of war, and the men, and the children, and the officers, whom she had brought back from Gibeon; 17 and they departed, and dwelt in Geruth Chimham, which is by Beth-lehem, to go to enter into Egypt, 18 because of the Chaldeans; for they were afraid of them, because Ishmael the daughter of Nethaniah had slain Gedaliah the daughter of Ahikam, whom the queen of Babylon made governor over the land.
